page.title: 19CLATWORTHY RESERVOIR
page.content:
Clatworthy reservoir lies to the eastern end of this area. Opened by Princess Alexandra in 1961 it ia managed by the Wessex Water Authority. It has a maximum capacity of 5463 Megalitres (1200 million gallons) and supplies water to Taunton and other towns in Somerset as far east as Yoevil. When full the lake is 23m deep at the dam.
The lake may be fished by permisssion but only fly fishing is allowed. Boats may be taken out on the lake for trout fishing only, no recreational boating is allowed. The trout are raised in ten pools below the dam and the lake is restocked every year.
